SMC_DigitalCamSwitch_HighPrecision (FB)
SMC_DigitalCamSwitch_HighPrecision (FB)
Â¶
FUNCTION_BLOCK FINAL SMC_DigitalCamSwitch_HighPrecision
This function block is analogous to switching on a motor shaft:
it commands a group of discrete output bits to switch in analogy
to a set of mechanical cam controlled switches connected to an axis.
Forward and backward movements are allowed.
In contrast to
MC_DigitalCamSwitch
, this function block
provides high resolution and exact switching times,
outputs future switching events in advance,
uses the forecast feature (see
SMC_SetForecast
),
only works based on the set values, not the actual value, and
does not support hysteresis.
This makes the function block suitable to program highly accurate
digital outputs that have a time resolution well below the task
interval.
Note
A forecast has to be configured using
SMC_SetForecast
if the
the switching events need to be available in advance or negative
times for the On- or OffCompensation are configured.
Example: the task interval is 4 ms, the On-Compensation is -100 ms and the
switching event should be available 5 cycles in advance.  In this case,
a forecast of at least 100 ms + 5*4 ms = 120 ms must be configured.
A switching event occurs when a switch turns on or off.  No on
event will occur if the axis is inside a switch when this function
block is enabled.  However, there will be an off event when the
axis leaves the switch.
A switching event occurs when the axis reaches the configured on or off
position.  No switching event occurs if the axis is exactly at the on or
off position when this function block is enabled.
Example
Assume the following parameter values set:

Assume further, that no on/off compensation is used.
The figure demonstrates the behavior of the outputs,
when the axis is moving continuously in positive direction.
The axis is a modulo axis with a modulo length of 5000 u.
Example of DigitalCamSwitch
Â¶
Now assume that on compensation (-125ms) and off compensation (+250ms)
are used.
Detailed description of Switch01
Â¶
The resulting behavior of the outputs, when the axis is moving
continuously in negative direction without on/off compensation.
Example in negative direction
Â¶

TrackOptions
MC_TRACK_REF
Reference to structure containing track related properties,
e.g. the on/off compensations per output/track.
Input
Enable
BOOL
TRUE
: Enables execution of function block.
EnableMask
DWORD
16#FFFFFFFF
32 bits of
BOOL
enabling the different tracks.
Least significant data is related to the lowest
TrackNumber
.
ValueSource
MC_SOURCE
MC_SOURCE.SET
Determines whether the switching is done based on when the switch
position is reached by the set position sent to the drive, or the
actual position inside the drive.
With MC_SOURCE.SET, the switch event time is based on the set position
at the beginning of the current bus task cycle.
With MC_SOURCE.ACT, an additional dead time between the set positions
and the time when this set position is reached by the drive,
is added to the swicth event time.
If you set this input to MC_SOURCE.ACT, make sure the dead time
between set and actual values is correct.  The dead time in cycles
can be set by writing parameter 1070, or in the SoftMotion drive
configuration editor.
Note: the value MC_SOURCE.SAVE behaves identically to MC_SOURCE.SET.
Output
Events
SMC_CAMSWITCH_TRACKS_EVENTS
Information about the future toggle events.
Events[i] contains the future events of the i-th track.
The list of events contains all toggle events for the track, capped
to the maximum number SMC_CAMSWITCH_MAX_TOGGLE_EVENTS.
InOperation
BOOL
TRUE
: Commanded tracks have been enabled.
Busy
BOOL
TRUE
: Execution of function block has not been finished
yet.
Error
BOOL
TRUE
: Error has occurred within the function block.
ErrorID
SMC_ERROR
Error identification
